title: (x) Parowan Chamber of Commerce script-like display face - Sprint {Mike F}
content:
Hello, any ideas on what typeface this is, can’t quite put my finger on it.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/chamberlogoc2_5867.jpg)

Thanks in advance.

 [‹ Need to know what font this is](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44850 "Go to previous forum topic") [Last shadow puppets logo type and old script face ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44817 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Trick

comments.content:
Still no ideas on this one? Here is a larger example of the typeface if that helps at all.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/chamberlogoc3_5809.jpg)

Thanks again.

Hi Patrick,

never seen this … What’s the source?  
While I like the ‘p’, I find the ‘a’ rather … unusual, and the ‘t’ downright ugly.  
The only typeface that comes to my mind is [David Quay](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/David%252BQuay)’s irregular script [Coptek](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/itc/coptek/?sample_text=past&sample_size=96) – I am not saying that it is anywhere close, though.  
F

I am putting together an ad for a town I grew up in, but no longer live at (oh the nostalgia). Was just trying to match the typefaces they used in their logo. Here is said logo.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/chamberlogoc4_4279.jpg)

Pretty sure “Parowan” is Anna and “Chamber of Commerce” is copperplate, but just can’t find anything for the top text.

~Patrick

I’ve seen it before on free font sites as “Splash” - not sure if it’s a rip off or not.

- Lex
Your script is manually condensed [Sprint](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/sprint/) (Aldo Novarese, 1974).

Thank you so very much Mike!

~Patrick
No wonder it looked strange – it was [squooshed](http://web.archive.org/web/20080709015318/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/squooshed)!
